column4: hey guys when i try to run my updates i get the following : http://pastebin.com/m1fa71150, i am new to linux any suggestions?
That happened to me yesterday. I d/l'ed a package...Google Earth I think, and closed it while it was running.
so pkill googleearth?
Did you dpkg --configure -a?
Open up a terminal window, and type dpkg --configure -a.
So if dpkg is complaining, it usually means that something interrupted the package from installing. At least, I think so.
thnx it worked but it says that i have one broken package now.
Ok, what is the name of the package?
one sec let me restart x
Ok...hmm. Try running "sudo apt-get autoremove && sudo apt_get clean"
That should remove the broken package and clean things up. If you have troubles updating your system after that, then just use "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade"
k what do i do now, it doesnot tell me the package that is broken
You do nothing, my good man. :-) Problem should be gone.
Could you pastebin the results of your dpkg --configure -a cmd please?
This is what you get when you run 'sudo dpkg --configure -a'?
with cmd
this command i already know it did fix the packages but now it starts to update but it says that one of the packages are courapted
Could you tell us the precise error msg about the package corruption?

Oh okay. :-) I know. Go to System -> Administration -> Synaptic Package Manager. Then click on the Custom Filter button and select Broken from the list above. That should list the broken package. Uncheck the tick next to its name, and click the Apply button.
np. Which package was broken?
